channel.title: Problem with the compiler
channel.description:
heres the error javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .
i have changed it to my version of jdk in the edit my jdk is 18 heres what it looks like in the edit @echo off title Compiler "C:/Program Files/Java\jdk1.6.0_18/bin/javac.exe" *.java pause can someone tell me what is wrong?

item.title: Problem with the compiler
item.dc:creator: @kingtren kingtren
item.description:
@kingtren wrote:

@echo off
title Simple Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

That would be the proper scripting.
You have a few forward slashes in there. They should all be back slashes.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with the compiler
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

mellen:

what do u mean by that

Say you have a folder with all your java files. We’ll name it “src”. if the “compile.bat” is not in that folder without a command directing where to find the files, then it can’t compile. say your compile.bat is on the desktop, and you have a folder called “server”. You need to add a command to look in “server” for the files.

cd server

add that on top of the javac code

Read full topic

@deathschaos9 wrote:

There are no java files in the directory of your compiler.
